abstract: Tiger Woods, preparing for his 20th Masters appearance, announces that he will take part in par-3 contest, largely so that his children can be his caddies; says his back feels healthy and rested following nearly two-month break from competitive play.
lead_paragraph: Woods, who has not competed in almost two months, had a tranquil tone as he said he would play in the par-3 contest, apparently so his children can be his caddies.

headline.main: At Masters, Tiger Woods Savors Sharing the Augusta Experience
headline.print_headline: Woods Savors Sharing the Augusta Experience

snippet: Woods, who has not competed in almost two months, had a tranquil tone as he said he would play in the par-3 contest, apparently so his children can be his caddies.
